GameState

Class MenuState

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameState.GameState
      • GameState.MenuState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class MenuState
extends GameState
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This class is the main menu of the game. It sets the correct size and also the various buttons on the main menu.
    Version:
    3.0 June 12 2014
    Author:
    Kareem Golaub modified by Peter Huang

        This integer initiates the myState variable to 0. Used to access other states.

        This integer initiates the menu value to 0.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MenuState

        public MenuState(GameStateManager gsm)
        This constructor sets the game state manager in the stage one state. Labels are also initiated and static constraints are set.
        Parameters:
        gsm - GameStateManager reference variable.

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method is overriden from game state, there is no implementation.
        Specified by:
        paintComponent in class GameState
        Parameters:
        g - java.awt.Graphics reference variable.

      • init

        public void init()
        This method initiates the game screen and frame per second. Removes things in other screens are replaces it with only the content of the menu.
        Specified by:
        init in class GameState

      • setStaticConstraints

        public void setStaticConstraints()
        Sets the constraints of components that don't move on the JPanel, and adds components in.

      • addMenu

        public void addMenu()
        This method adds the various buttons in the main menu.

      • initLabels

        public void initLabels()
        Initializes all the labels and buttons with their pictures. Also activates the labels and buttons.

        Variable Dictionary: Reference, Type, Purpose

        • titleImg, ImageIcon, holds the title image
        • neutImg, ImageIcon, holds the neutrophil image
        • eosImg, ImageIcon, holds the eosinophil image
        • basoImg, ImageIcon, holds the basophil image
        • nkImg, ImageIcon, holds the natural killer cell image
        • playImg, ImageIcon, holds the play button image
        • playRollImg, ImageIcon, holds the play button rollover image
        • instImg, ImageIcon, holds the instructions button image
        • instRollImg, ImageIcon, holds the instructions button rollover image
        • highScoreImg, ImageIcon, holds the high scores button image
        • highScoreRollImg, ImageIcon, holds the high scores button rollover image
        • studyImg, ImageIcon, holds the study button image
        • studyRollImg, ImageIcon, holds the study button rollover image
        • quitImg, ImageIcon, holds the quit button image
        • quitRollImg, ImageIcon, holds the quit button rollover image
        • backImg, ImageIcon, holds the back button image
        • backRollImg, ImageIcon, holds the back button rollover image
        • printImg, ImageIcon, holds the print button image
        • printRollImg, ImageIcon, holds the print button rollover image

      • setConstraints

        public void setConstraints()
        Removes cell JLabels, updates their constraints, and adds them back in.

        This method changes the values of the constraints for the main menu animation.

      • loadScores

        public void loadScores()
        This method loads the high scores onto the screen. Button locations and label locations and fonts are set.
        Parameters:
        font - Font reference variable
        read - Scanner variable reading from the scores.txt file
        e - Exception reference variable. Can print stack trace or display that the highscore is corrupted if actually corrupted.

      • loadInstructions

        public void loadInstructions()
        This method loads the instructions pane. Mnemonics are also set for the buttons. A window listener is also added here.
        Parameters:
        pane - JPanel reference variable
        slide1 - JButton reference variable for instructions page 1.
        slide2 - JButton reference variable for instructions page 2.
        slide3 - JButton reference variable for instructions page 3.
        slide4 - JButton reference variable for instructions page 4.
        slide5 - JButton reference variable for instructions page 5.
        slide6 - JButton reference variable for instructions page 6.
        slide7 - JButton reference variable for instructions page 7.
        slideClose - JButton reference variable for back to main menu button.
        toolbar - JToolBar reference variable for where the toolbar is placed.
        s - SpringLayout reference variable.
        instructionLabels - Arraylist of JLabels of instruction labels.
        instructionImages - ArrayList of JLabels of instruction images.
        e - Exception reference variable, prints the stack trace in case of error.

      • loadStudy

        public void loadStudy()
        This method loads the study pane. Mnemonics are also set for the buttons. A window listener is also added here.
        Parameters:
        pane - JPanel reference variable
        slide1 - JButton reference variable for study page 1.
        slide2 - JButton reference variable for study page 2.
        slide3 - JButton reference variable for study page 3.
        slide4 - JButton reference variable for study page 4.
        slide5 - JButton reference variable for study page 5.
        slideClose - JButton reference variable for back to main menu button.
        toolbar - JToolBar reference variable for where the toolbar is placed.
        s - SpringLayout reference variable.
        studyLabels - Arraylist of JLabels of study labels.
        studyImages - ArrayList of JLabels of study images.
        e - Exception reference variable, prints the stack trace in case of error.

      • addAnimation

        public void addAnimation()
        This method adds the animation of the main menu moving cells.

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        This method is overriden. No implementation is used in this method.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(int k)
        This method is overriden. No implementation is used in this method.
        Parameters:

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(int k)
        This method is overriden. No implementation is used in this method.
        Parameters:
        k - keyReleased int variable.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        This is the action performed method that sets the functions for each button when clicked. They include the main menu buttons, study buttons, instruction buttons, stage selectors, and allows printing when the print variable is clicked.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - ActionEvent refernece variable
        type - String variable that is substituted for ae reference variable.
        e - Exception reference variable.
